Alpha Omega Alpha, Alpha Chapter of Michigan, Records
1907-1967
did.abstract: Honor society at the University of Michigan Medical School. Meeting minutes, receipts, correspondence and published books of the Alpha Omega Alpha order, Alpha Chapter of Michigan.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group (Donor no. 7870) was received through Joel Howell, professor of internal medicine at the University of Michigan.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Alpha Omega Alpha, Alpha Chapter of Michigan, Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Alpha Omega Alpha is a non-secret, college medical honor society. Membership in the organization is based on scholarship. Founded in 1902 by medical students at the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Chicago, subsequent chapters were organized throughout the nation. The Alpha Chapter of Michigan, founded at the University of Michigan Medical School in 1907, was the first chapter in the state of Michigan. Activities centered around an annual banquet for initiation of new members and the annual presentation of student research projects.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence and material regarding the Student Research Forum make up the bulk of the collection. Correspondence to new initiates and acceptance letters make up the bulk of the correspondence files. The Student Research Forum files consist primarily of copies of the students' presentation. Banquet programs and notebooks of minutes also document the society's activity. The primary material is supplemented by published works, including a national directory and history of Alpha Omega Alpha.
